byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: Ares Management and the Canadian Pension Plan Investment Board will pay $22 a share, while the founding family will roll over its 33 percent stake.
snippet: Ares Management and the Canadian Pension Plan Investment Board will pay $22 a share, while the founding family will roll over its 33 percent stake.
lead_paragraph: The low-cost retailer 99 Cents Only Stores agreed on Tuesday to sell itself to a group of investors that includes its founding family for $1.6 billion in cash, ending a months-long sales process.

headline.main: 99 Cents Only Chain in $1.6 Billion Buyout
